channel.title: Hardware Section
channel.description:
Yeh wondering if you can get a hardware section, as we are all using computers here. Possibly a software section as well.
Hardware section where ppl can ask for advice on upgrades / info on latest technology / error fixing and shit like that. I'm all in for that section.

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:18, topic:217451”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=285735.msg2316890#msg2316890 date=1215332659]
there’s a neopet forum, there’s a homework forum, there’s a general programming forum, there’s a music forum… there’s tons of these forums outside of these forums but they are still here.

Hardly anyone plays neopets, some people don’t need homework as they are not in school, some people don’t program here, some people don’t use music. Yet everyone uses a computer/hardware.

I just thought it would be nice since people are posting computer-ish threads in the general/question’s forum. Or even a Computers/IT section.
[/quote]

Some people are smart enough to do it themselves. You don’t have a valid statement.[/quote]

Then the smarter ones can help the ones that don’t know what they are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:18, topic:217451”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=285735.msg2316890#msg2316890 date=1215332659]
there’s a neopet forum, there’s a homework forum, there’s a general programming forum, there’s a music forum… there’s tons of these forums outside of these forums but they are still here.

Hardly anyone plays neopets, some people don’t need homework as they are not in school, some people don’t program here, some people don’t use music. Yet everyone uses a computer/hardware.

I just thought it would be nice since people are posting computer-ish threads in the general/question’s forum. Or even a Computers/IT section.
[/quote]

Some people are smart enough to do it themselves. You don’t have a valid statement.[/quote]

Some people are not. I think it is a great idea because I am so lazy. Instead of wasting my time looking around I can just post my question and have an answer within 3-5 days.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

frank_:

go to a community for hardware/overclocking

Exactly. The only reason xEnt wants this is to show of his ‘knowledge’ of computers. There’s no reason to have a board like this. If they need help they can post in the general section.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:13, topic:217451”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=285735.msg2314142#msg2314142 date=1215194921]
Yeh wondering if you can get a hardware section, as we are all using computers here.
[/quote]
:eek:

Isn’t that a given since this a website? Unless you all are using iTouches etc, to veiw this site and I’m the only one on a computer here

Edit:

I think its a good idea and @RIP just go to newegg[/quote]

I don’t really care about the prices, newegg ones don’t even count for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:217619”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=285735.msg2315142#msg2315142 date=1215239467]
Also how about an Overclocking subforum?
[/quote]

Is there really that much to say about overclocking? People could just post that in the general hardware section.[/quote]
I guess you’re not an overclocker. there’s quite a bit to say about it, but since it wouldn’t be used that much on these forums i guess it can just go in the hardware section.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

People will use it, i know my hardware… and i know many noobs who would wanna upgrade their 15 year old computers for runescape HD haha.

People dont understand how much money you can save if you know where to look. You can get an average-high end computer these days for under 500$ if you know what you’re doing.

Also how about an Overclocking subforum?

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

On another topic

Start the board, if nobody uses it then delete the board.

That’s the kind of response stopping me from creating it.

[quote=“Greeny, post:6, topic:217451”]Niall, CM section —> The demote Iwontseethenametoprotectim thread —> find my posts.

You’ll see considerable support for my ideas.[/quote]

Your influence is growing, I see the Greeny movement is going well.

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah I think it’d be used. I am always seeing a thread like “How much Ram do I need?” etc etc.

By the way Niall & other admins, don’t suppose you’ve been able to give me permissions to moderate the Clan section yet?

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Section
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Greeny:

I suggested this somewhere, but the admins aren’t doing much atm.

I did not see this, but if I did, the only problem I would have with creating the board is who will actually post there? I built this computer but I’m not fantastic with hardware, especially the older stuff/ati. Greeny is the only person I know who would take well to it(well, xxlegitxx too but he isn’t here), and with not much existing demand for such a board it’ll be pretty inactive. (Sort of like the clan board - heh).

I have no problem making such a board, I just want to know if it’ll be used, what are your thoughts guys?

Read full topic

item.description:
